snippet: Events like slopestyle, halfpipe and aerials might have changed the look of the Olympics, but the risks they involve are nothing new. Just ask Billy Kidd, a skiing medalist fifty years ago.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column contends that skiing events like slopestyle, halfpipe and aerials may have changed look of the Olympics, but the risks they involve are nothing new; says possibility of serious injury or even death has always lurked around the next corner in ski events at Winter Games.
lead_paragraph: Events like slopestyle, halfpipe and aerials might have changed the look of the Olympics, but the risks they involve are nothing new. Just ask Billy Kidd, a skiing medalist fifty years ago.

headline.main: For Daredevils on Snow, the Edge Has Always Been Near
headline.print_headline: For Daredevils on Snow, the Edge Has Always Been Near
